qas.question: What is the appearance of green in th eyes attributed to?
Where are green eyes most common?
Among Icelandic and Dutch adults, which sex more commonly has green eyes?
Where is the green pigment in eyes located?
Blue and green eyes are caused by a high concentration of what?
What percentage of women in South Asia have blue or green eyes?
Which two ancestries have the least amount of green eyes?
What is the name for the scattering of light that results in the green coloring?

context: There is no green pigment in green eyes; like the color of blue eyes, it is <a0_0>an optical illusion<a0_0/>; its appearance is caused by the combination of an amber or light brown pigmentation of <b3_0>the stroma<b3_0/>, given by a low or moderate concentration of <b4_0>melanin<b4_0/>, with the blue tone imparted by the <b7_0>Rayleigh<b7_0/> scattering of the reflected light. Green eyes are most common in <a1_0>Northern and Central Europe<a1_0/>. They can also be found in Southern Europe, West Asia, Central Asia, and South Asia. In Iceland, <b5_0>89%<b5_0/> of women and 87% of men have either blue or green eye color. A study of Icelandic and Dutch adults found green eyes to be much more prevalent in <a2_0>women<a2_0/> than in men. Among European Americans, green eyes are most common among those of recent <b6_0>Celtic and Germanic<b6_0/> ancestry, about 16%.
